title: Labelexpo 2023: Heidelberg and Gallus showcase three new products - printweek
summary: Heidelberg and Gallus introduced digital solutions promoting smart, connected printing at Labelexpo Europe 2023. These innovations address industry challenges, offering high levels of automation, cost-effectiveness, and sustainability.
green_innovation: FALSE This article mainly focuses on digital solutions and automation in the print industry, rather than specifically on environmental sustainability goals.
business_innovation: TRUE The article discusses the introduction of new digital solutions and innovations, signifying a business innovation within the firm's product offerings and processes.
green_product: FALSE While the innovations mentioned aim to increase productivity and reduce waste, there is no explicit mention of their significant environmental impact reduction or sustainable life cycle.
green_process: FALSE The focus of the article is on digital solutions and automation in the printing industry, with no detailed information provided about specific processes that minimize environmental impacts.
official_company_name: Heidelberger Druckmaschinen AG and Gallus Group
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 323119 - Other Commercial Printing, 333244 - Printing Machinery and Equipment Manufacturing, 511120 - Periodical Publishers, 561410 - Document Preparation Services
greenwashing: FALSE The article focuses on the introduction of digital solutions and innovations within the printing industry, without making false or misleading environmental benefit claims.

title: Ashok Chaturvedi unveils report on recyclability of multi-layered aseptic packaging - printweek
summary: The article discusses UFlex's investment in recycling multi-layered aseptic packaging through Enzymatic Delamination Technology and promoting sustainability.
green_innovation: TRUE. This qualifies as green innovation because it involves developing technology to enable aseptic packaging recycling, which contributes to waste reduction and promotes environmental sustainability.
business_innovation: TRUE. This qualifies as a business innovation as UFlex is introducing a new technology for recycling multi-layered aseptic packaging, which differs significantly from their previous processes.
green_product: TRUE. This is a green product as UFlex's focus on recycling multi-layered aseptic packaging reduces environmental impact by promoting sustainable practices in packaging.
green_process: TRUE. This is a green process as the Enzymatic Delamination Technology utilized by UFlex in aseptic packaging recycling minimizes environmental impacts and improves sustainability in their operational activity.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 322219 - Other Paperboard Container Manufacturing, 326199 - All Other Plastics Product Manufacturing, 561910 - Packaging and Labeling Services, 562998 - All Other Miscellaneous Waste Management Services
greenwashing: FALSE. This does not appear to be an example of greenwashing as the article discusses tangible investments and technologies towards sustainability without misleading environmental claims.
